entry.title: üí°BTP Trial Platform SSO ‚Äì Game Changer for New Customers & POCs
entry.content:
üöÄüîê‚ú®Enabling Platform SSO for SAP BTP Trial Accounts using SAP Cloud Identity Services (IAS)

About Me

Hare Krishna üôè I am an SAP BTP Cloud Architect sharing practical insights, solutions, and real-world experiences from the SAP ecosystem.

üåüIntroduction

Until recently, SAP BTP Trial accounts did not support Platform SSO. This meant that trial users had to rely on S-User IDs or SAP IDs for cockpit access, making it harder to onboard new users quickly for POCs (Proof of Concepts).

With the latest update, Platform SSO is now available for Trial accounts as well! üéâ

This is a huge enabler for:

  • New customers exploring SAP BTP for the first time.

  • Partners and developers who want to quickly set up POCs.

  • Teams that want to onboard users without waiting for an S-User.

  • Anyone looking to integrate IAS (Identity Authentication Service) or external IdPs like Azure AD, Okta, etc. for authentication.

üëâIn short: You can now enable SSO in your Trial just like in Enterprise accounts, which makes POCs faster, more secure, and realistic while giving new customers a smooth onboarding experience.

üåüAdvantages at a Glance

  • Seamless SSO: Log in to BTP cockpit and CLI with one identity.

  • Flexible IdP Options: Use IAS or integrate with Azure AD, Okta, or other IdPs.

  • Faster POCs & Onboarding: New trial users can get started without an SAP S-user.

  • Enhanced Security: Centralized user management, MFA, and consistent policies via IAS.

  • Scalable Setup: The same trust model works when you move from trial to productive accounts.

üìäFlow Diagram (Text-Based)

[User Login] 
     ‚îÇ
     ‚ñº
[BTP Cockpit / CLI] ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ> [Redirect to IAS] ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ> [Authenticate with IAS User]
     ‚îÇ
     ‚ñº
[Return to BTP Global/Subaccount] ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ> [Access Cockpit / CLI with IAS Identity]
‚Äã

üîëWhy Platform SSO is a Game-Changer

  1. Unified Login Experience
    Platform SSO centralizes access for all BTP platform users. Whether you use IAS or a corporate IdP (Azure AD, Okta, Ping, etc.), everyone authenticates the same way ‚Äî no juggling multiple accounts.

  2. Security & Compliance
    With IAS or enterprise IdPs, you can enforce strong security controls: MFA, conditional access, SCIM provisioning, and user lifecycle policies. This significantly improves compliance posture compared to standalone trial logins.

  3. Faster POCs & Onboarding
    Before, trial accounts required S-Users which slowed down enablement. Now customers, partners, and developers can get started instantly with IAS-based trial logins. That means faster POCs, demos, and hackathon setups.

  4. Developer Productivity
    Developers can seamlessly use the same IAS login in both BTP Cockpit and BTP CLI. This avoids login confusion and makes CLI automation scripts more consistent.

  5. Future-Proof Architecture
    Platform SSO with IAS scales from trial to production. What you set up for trial POCs can be extended to full enterprise setups without redesigning your security model.

üîºHigh-Level Steps

  1. Enable & Activate Cloud Identity Services (IAS)
    Subscribe to IAS from your BTP global account. You‚Äôll get an activation email to set up your tenant.

  2. Establish Trust Between BTP and IAS
    Configure trust in BTP cockpit so that IAS acts as the identity provider.

  3. Create Users
    Create a user in IAS, then create the same user in BTP cockpit against IAS IdP and assign required roles.

  4. Login via Platform SSO URL
    Access BTP cockpit using the Platform SSO URL that redirects to IAS for authentication.

  5. Verify Access in Trial Account
    Ensure the IAS user lands successfully in the trial subaccount.

  6. Extend SSO to BTP CLI
    Log in to BTP CLI using the same IAS credentials.

‚öôÔ∏èStep-by-Step Guide

Step 1: Create IAS Tenant (Cloud Identity Services)

  • Subscribe to SAP Cloud Identity Services (default subscription).

  • You‚Äôll receive an activation email to set up your IAS tenant.

  • This IAS tenant will serve as the trusted IdP for BTP platform login.

üîóExample IAS Tenant:
aym6uhvub.trial-accounts.ondemand.com

Step 2: Configure Trust at Global Account Level

  1. Navigate to your Global Account in BTP Cockpit.

  2. Go to: Security ‚Üí Trust Configuration ‚Üí Establish Trust.

  3. Select your IAS tenant.

  4. Configure:

    • Tenant

    • Domain

    • Origin Key (unique identifier)

  5. Review & confirm.

‚úÖOnce done, IAS will appear as a Custom Identity Provider for Platform Users.

üîëStep 3: Create & Assign Users

  • First, create the user in IAS (example: btptrialiasuser@test.com).

  • Then, go to BTP cockpit ‚Üí Security ‚Üí Users, and create the same user against the IAS IdP you configured.

  • Finally, assign the appropriate roles/role collections (e.g., Global Account Admin, Subaccount Admin, or custom role collections).

Create user in IAS

Create user in BTP Global account

Assign User required privileges

Step 4: Login URL Creation

Use the following syntax to generate IAS login URL for cockpit access:

https://<TENANTID>.<REGION>.hana.ondemand.com/cockpit?idp=<TRUSTEDIDP>.accounts.ondemand.com
 
üîóExample (trial):
https://account.hanatrial.ondemand.com/trial?idp=aym6uhvub.trial-accounts.ondemand.com#/home/trial

üëâHere, aym6uhvub is the IAS tenant identifier (highlighted).

Step 5: Authenticate with IAS

  • Open the URL ‚Üí You‚Äôll be redirected to IAS login screen.

  • Enter IAS user credentials (e.g., btptrialiasuser@test.com).

  • On successful login ‚Üí Click ‚ÄúGo to Your Trial Account‚Äù.

‚ú®You‚Äôre now inside the BTP Cockpit with IAS credentials (instead of S-User).

üîêLogging in with IAS via BTP CLI

Apart from cockpit login, SAP BTP CLI also supports Platform SSO with IAS.
This is especially useful for developers and administrators working with scripts, automation, or CI/CD pipelines.

Steps to Login

  1. Open your terminal.

  2. Run the following command with your IAS details and origin key:

 
btp login --idp <ORIGIN_KEY> --user <yourIASuser@example.com> --password <yourPassword>

Verify the Login

After successful login, you can test by listing your subaccounts:

btp list accounts/subaccount

 

‚úÖThis confirms that IAS-based authentication works not only in the cockpit but also with BTP CLI, making Platform SSO truly end-to-end.

‚ùìFAQs ‚Äì Platform SSO for BTP Trial

Q1: Can I use Platform SSO in a Trial account without an S-User?
A: Yes! Trial accounts now support Platform SSO via IAS or any configured Identity Provider. You no longer need an S-User for cockpit or CLI access.

Q2: Do I need to create a user in both IAS and BTP?
A: Yes. Create the user in IAS first, then create the corresponding user in BTP linked to the IAS IdP and assign the necessary roles.

Q3: Can I use Azure AD or another IdP instead of IAS?
A: Yes, any trusted Identity Provider configured at the global account level can be used for Platform SSO.

Q4: Does Platform SSO work for both cockpit and CLI?
A: Absolutely. You can log in to BTP cockpit via the SSO URL and to BTP CLI using the --idp and origin key.

Q5: Why is an origin key needed for CLI login?
A: The origin key tells the CLI which Identity Provider to use for authentication, especially when multiple IdPs are configured.

Q6: Is Platform SSO secure?
A: Yes. By using IAS or any trusted IdP, authentication is centralized, supports MFA, and follows enterprise-grade security policies.

üéØConclusion

With Platform SSO now enabled for trial accounts, SAP has made it much easier for new customers, partners, and developers to:

  • Run POCs faster üöÄ

  • Onboard trial users without S-User IDs üîë

  • Experience enterprise-grade SSO with IAS üîí

This change is a big step forward for customer adoption and onboarding in SAP BTP.

üôè Thank You

A special thanks to SAP for enabling Platform SSO in Trial accounts, making it easier for new customers, partners, and developers to explore SAP BTP securely and efficiently.
This update truly accelerates POCs, onboarding, and hands-on learning for everyone.

entry.title: How to find the line items that made up settlement? This may help.
entry.content:
I could be missing some obvious table or logic but for years I have found it impossible to find the source line items that made up the totals in a settlement document.  I searched high and low and I could never find SAP's logic.  So I decided to take a kick at it using HANA SQL.  Please be gentle in your responses as I am sure there is a better way, better sql, etc.

The problem I needed to solve is to be able to find Orders line items that settled to Projects and here is how I did it.

 

 
 /********* Begin Procedure Script ************/ 
 BEGIN 
 	 var_out = WITH BASE_DATA
AS (
	SELECT T1."MANDT" AS "CLIENT"
		,T1."LEDNR" AS "LEDGER"
		,T1."VERSN" AS "VERSION"
		,T1."KOKRS" AS "CONTROLLINGAREA"
		,T1."BUKRS" AS "COMPANYCODE"
		,T1."GSBER" AS "BUSINESSAREA"
		,T1."OBJNR" AS "OBJECTNUMBER"
		,T1."ACCASTY" AS "OBJECTTYPE"
		,T1."BELNR" AS "DOCUMENTNUMBER"
		,T1."BLTXT" AS "DOCHEADERTEXT"
		,T1."SGTXT" AS "SEGMENTTEXT"
		,T1."ZLENR" AS "DOCITEMNUMBER"
		,T1."BUZEI" AS "POSTINGROW"
		,T1."GJAHR" AS "FISCALYEAR"
		,T1."PERIO" AS "PERIOD"
		,T1."BUDAT" AS "POSTINGDATE_S"
		,TO_DATE(NULLIF(T1."BUDAT", '00000000'), 'YYYYMMDD') AS "POSTINGDATE_E"		
		,T1."BLDAT" AS "DOCUMENTDATE_S"
		,TO_DATE(NULLIF(T1."BLDAT", '00000000'), 'YYYYMMDD') AS "DOCUMENTDATE_E"		
		,T1."CPUDT" AS "DATECREATED_S"
		,TO_DATE(NULLIF(T1."CPUDT", '00000000'), 'YYYYMMDD') AS "DATECREATED_E"		
		,T1."CPUTM" AS "TIMECREATED_S"
		,TO_TIME(NULLIF(T1."CPUTM", '000000'), 'HHMISS') AS "TIMECREATED_E"
		,UTCTOLOCAL(ADD_SECONDS(TO_DATE('1990-01-01', 'YYYY-MM-DD'), CAST((CAST(T1."TIMESTMP" / 10000 AS INT)) AS INT)), 'PST') AS "DATETIMECREATED"
		,T1."KSTAR" AS "COSTELEMENT"
		,T1."HRKFT" AS "COSUBKEY"
		,T1."WKGBTR" AS "TOTALCACUR"
		,T1."WKFBTR" AS "FIXEDVALUECACUR"
		,T1."KWAER" AS "CACURRENCY"
		,T1."MEGBTR" AS "TOTALQUANTITY"
		,T1."MEFBTR" AS "FIXEDQUANTITY"
		,T1."MEINH" AS "UNITOFMEASURE"
		,T1."VRGNG" AS "BUSTRANSACTION"
		,T1."WRTTP" AS "VALUETYPE"
		,T1."BEKNZ" AS "DEBITCREDIT"
		,T1."REFBN" AS "REFDOCUMENTNO"
		,COALESCE(LPAD(T2."ABRNR", 10, '0'), '') AS "SETTLEMENTSEQUENCE"
		,COALESCE(T2."GJAHR", '') AS "SETTLEMENTYEAR"
		,COALESCE(T2."PERIO", '') AS "SETTLEMENTPERIOD"
		,COALESCE(T2."STBEL", '') AS "DOCUMENTREVERSED"
		,COALESCE(T1."STOKZ", '') AS "REVERSED"
		,COALESCE(T1."STFLG", '') AS "REVERSALDOC"
		,T1."AWTYP" AS "REFPROCEDURE"
		,T3."PSPEL" AS "WBSELEMENTID"
		,T4."OBJNR" AS "WBSELEMENTOBJECT"
		,T4."POSKI" AS "WBSELEMENTSHORTID"
		,T1."EBELN" AS "PURCHASINGDOC"
		,T1."EBELP" AS "PURCHASINGDOCITEM"
		,T1."PERNR" AS "PERSONNELNUMBER"
		,T1."PAROB" AS "PARTNEROBJECT"
		,T1."MATNR" AS "MATERIALNUMBER"
		,T1."WERKS" AS "PLANT"
		,T1."GKONT" AS "OFFSETACCTNO"
		,T1."GKOAR" AS "OFFSETACCTTYPE"
	FROM "V_COVP" AS T1
	LEFT JOIN "AUAK" AS T2
		ON T1."MANDT" = T2."MANDT" AND T1."REFBN" = T2."BELNR"
	INNER JOIN "AUFK" AS T3
		ON T1."MANDT" = T3."MANDT" AND T1."OBJNR" = T3."OBJNR" AND T3."PSPEL" <> '00000000' AND (T3."AUTYP" IN ( '01' , '06' , '30' ))
	INNER JOIN "PRPS" AS T4
		ON T3."MANDT" = T4."MANDT" AND T3."PSPEL" = T4."PSPNR"
	WHERE T1."MANDT" = SESSION_CONTEXT('CLIENT') AND T1."ACCASTY" = 'OR' AND T1."GJAHR" BETWEEN :P_FISCAL_YEAR_FROM AND :P_FISCAL_YEAR_TO
	)
	,SORTED_DATA
AS (
	SELECT *
		,ROW_NUMBER() OVER (
			PARTITION BY "OBJECTNUMBER" ORDER BY "FISCALYEAR"
				,"PERIOD"
				,"DATECREATED_S"
				,"TIMECREATED_S"
				,"DOCITEMNUMBER"
			) AS "ROWNUMBER"
	FROM BASE_DATA
	ORDER BY "OBJECTNUMBER"
		,"FISCALYEAR"
		,"PERIOD"
		,"DATETIMECREATED"
		,"DOCITEMNUMBER"
	)
	,MATCHED_DATA
AS (
	SELECT T1.*
		,COALESCE((
				SELECT FIRST_VALUE("REFDOCUMENTNO" ORDER BY "ROWNUMBER")
				FROM SORTED_DATA AS T2
				WHERE T2."OBJECTNUMBER" = T1."OBJECTNUMBER" AND T2."DEBITCREDIT" = 'A' AND T2."ROWNUMBER" > T1."ROWNUMBER" AND T2."COSTELEMENT" = T1."COSTELEMENT" AND T2."REVERSED" = '' AND T2."REVERSALDOC" = '' AND T1."DEBITCREDIT" <> 'A'
				), '') AS "SETTLEMENTDOCUMENT"
        ,COALESCE((
				SELECT FIRST_VALUE("POSTINGDATE_S" ORDER BY "ROWNUMBER")
				FROM SORTED_DATA AS T2
				WHERE T2."OBJECTNUMBER" = T1."OBJECTNUMBER" AND T2."DEBITCREDIT" = 'A' AND T2."ROWNUMBER" > T1."ROWNUMBER" AND T2."COSTELEMENT" = T1."COSTELEMENT" AND T2."REVERSED" = '' AND T2."REVERSALDOC" = '' AND T1."DEBITCREDIT" <> 'A'
				), '') AS "SETTLEMENTDATE_S"				
        ,COALESCE((
				SELECT FIRST_VALUE("DOCUMENTNUMBER" ORDER BY "ROWNUMBER")
				FROM SORTED_DATA AS T2
				WHERE T2."OBJECTNUMBER" = T1."OBJECTNUMBER" AND T2."DEBITCREDIT" = 'A' AND T2."ROWNUMBER" > T1."ROWNUMBER" AND T2."COSTELEMENT" = T1."COSTELEMENT" AND T2."REVERSED" = '' AND T2."REVERSALDOC" = '' AND T1."DEBITCREDIT" <> 'A'
				), '') AS "PRDOCUMENTNUMBER"				
	FROM SORTED_DATA T1
	ORDER BY T1."OBJECTNUMBER"
		,T1."ROWNUMBER"
	)
	,FINAL_DATA
AS (
	SELECT T1."CLIENT"
		,T1."LEDGER"
		,T2."DDTEXT" AS "LEDGERTEXT"
		,T1."VERSION"
		,T3.TXT AS "VERSIONTEXT"
		,T1."CONTROLLINGAREA"
		,T4."BEZEI" AS "CONTROLLINGAREATEXT"
		,T4."KTOPL" AS "CHARTOFACCOUNTS"
		,T18."KTPLT" AS "CHARTOFACCOUNTSTEXT"
		,T1."COMPANYCODE"
		,T19."BUTXT" AS "COMPANYCODETEXT"
		,T1."BUSINESSAREA"
		,T20."GTEXT" AS "BUSINESSAREATEXT"
		,T1."OBJECTNUMBER"
		,T1."OBJECTTYPE"
		,T5."OBART_LD" AS "OBJECTTYPE_EN"
		,CASE WHEN T5."TXT60" != '' THEN "TXT60" WHEN T5."TXT20" != '' THEN "TXT20" WHEN T5."TXT15" != '' THEN "TXT15" ELSE T5."TXT10" END AS "OBJECTTYPETEXT"
		,T1."DOCUMENTNUMBER"
		,T1."DOCHEADERTEXT"
		,T1."SEGMENTTEXT"
		,T1."DOCITEMNUMBER"
		,T1."POSTINGROW"
		,T1."FISCALYEAR"
		,T1."PERIOD"
		,T1."POSTINGDATE_S"
		,T1."POSTINGDATE_E"
		,T1."DOCUMENTDATE_S"
		,T1."DOCUMENTDATE_E"		
		,T1."DATECREATED_S"
		,T1."DATECREATED_E"		
		,T1."TIMECREATED_S"
		,T1."TIMECREATED_E"		
		,T1."DATETIMECREATED"
		,T1."COSTELEMENT"
		,T7."LTEXT" AS "COSTELEMENTTEXT"
		,T1."COSUBKEY"
		,T1."TOTALCACUR"
		,T1."FIXEDVALUECACUR"
		,T1."CACURRENCY"
		,T6."KTEXT" AS "CACURRENCYTEXT"
		,T1."TOTALQUANTITY"
		,T1."FIXEDQUANTITY"
		,T1."UNITOFMEASURE"
		,T8."MSEH3" AS "UNITOFMEASSUREENG"
		,T8."MSEHT" AS "UNITOFMEASSURETEXT"
		,T1."BUSTRANSACTION"
		,T11."TXT" AS "BUSTRANSACTIONTEXT"
		,T1."VALUETYPE"
		,T9."DDTEXT" AS "VALUETYPETEXT"
		,T1."DEBITCREDIT"
		,T10."BEKNZ_LD" AS "DEBITCREDIT_EN"
		,T10."DDTEXT" AS "DEBITCREDITTEXT"
		,T1."REFDOCUMENTNO"
		,T1."SETTLEMENTSEQUENCE"
		,T1."SETTLEMENTYEAR"
		,T1."SETTLEMENTPERIOD"
		,T1."DOCUMENTREVERSED"
		,T1."REVERSED"
		,T1."REVERSALDOC"
		,T1."SETTLEMENTDOCUMENT"
		,T1."SETTLEMENTDATE_S"
		,TO_DATE(NULLIF(T1."SETTLEMENTDATE_S", '00000000'), 'YYYYMMDD') AS "SETTLEMENTDATE_E"	
		,T1."PRDOCUMENTNUMBER"	
		,T1."REFPROCEDURE"
		,T12."OTEXT" AS "REFPROCEDURETEXT"
		,T1."WBSELEMENTID"
		,T1."WBSELEMENTOBJECT"
		,T1."WBSELEMENTSHORTID"
		,T1."PURCHASINGDOC"
		,T1."PURCHASINGDOCITEM"
		,T13."TXZ01" AS "PURCHASINGDOCITEMTEXT"
		,T13."LIFNR" AS "SUPPLIER"
		,TRIM(T21."NAME1" || ' ' || T21."NAME2") AS "SUPPLIERNAME"
		,T1."PERSONNELNUMBER"
		,T14."ENAME" AS "EMPLOYEENAME"
		,T1."PARTNEROBJECT"
		,T1."MATERIALNUMBER"
		,T15."MAKTX" AS "MATERIALTEXT"
		,T1."PLANT"
		,T17."NAME1" AS "PLANTTEXT"
		,T1."OFFSETACCTNO"
		,T1."OFFSETACCTTYPE"
		,T16."DDTEXT" AS "OFFSETACCTTYPETEXT"
		,T1."ROWNUMBER"
	FROM MATCHED_DATA AS T1
	INNER JOIN "DD07T" AS T2
		ON T1."LEDGER" = T2."DOMVALUE_L" AND T2."DOMNAME" = 'LEDNR' AND T2."DDLANGUAGE" = 'E' AND T2."AS4LOCAL" = 'A'
	INNER JOIN "TKT09" AS T3
		ON T1."CLIENT" = T3."MANDT" AND T1."CONTROLLINGAREA" = T3."KOKRS" AND T1."VERSION" = T3."VERSN" AND T3."LANGU" = 'E'
	INNER JOIN "TKA01" AS T4
		ON T1."CLIENT" = T4."MANDT" AND T1."CONTROLLINGAREA" = T4."KOKRS"
	INNER JOIN "TBO01" AS T5
		ON T1."OBJECTTYPE" = T5."OBART" AND T5."SPRAS" = 'E'
	INNER JOIN "TCURT" AS T6
		ON T1."CLIENT" = T6."MANDT" AND T1."CACURRENCY" = T6."WAERS" AND T6."SPRAS" = 'E'
	INNER JOIN "CSKU" AS T7
		ON T1."CLIENT" = T7."MANDT" AND T4."KTOPL" = T7."KTOPL" AND T1."COSTELEMENT" = T7."KSTAR" AND T7."SPRAS" = 'E'
	LEFT JOIN "T006A" AS T8
		ON T1."CLIENT" = T8."MANDT" AND T1."UNITOFMEASURE" = T8."MSEHI" AND T8."SPRAS" = 'E'
	INNER JOIN "DD07T" AS T9
		ON T1."VALUETYPE" = T9."DOMVALUE_L" AND T9."DOMNAME" = 'CO_WRTTP' AND T9."DDLANGUAGE" = 'E' AND T9."AS4LOCAL" = 'A'
	INNER JOIN (
		SELECT "DD07T"."DOMVALUE_L"
			,"DD07T"."DDTEXT"
			,"TKABE"."BEKNZ_LD"
		FROM "DD07T"
		INNER JOIN "TKABE"
			ON "DD07T"."DOMVALUE_L" = "TKABE"."BEKNZ" AND "TKABE"."SPRAS" = 'E'
		WHERE "DD07T"."DOMNAME" = 'BEKNZ' AND "DD07T"."DDLANGUAGE" = 'E' AND "DD07T"."AS4LOCAL" = 'A'
		) AS T10
		ON T1."DEBITCREDIT" = T10."DOMVALUE_L"
	INNER JOIN "TJ01T" AS T11
		ON T1."BUSTRANSACTION" = T11."VRGNG" AND T11."SPRAS" = 'E'
	INNER JOIN "TTYPT" AS T12
		ON T1."REFPROCEDURE" = T12."AWTYP" AND T12."SPRAS" = 'E'
	LEFT JOIN (
		SELECT "EKKO"."MANDT"
			,"EKKO"."EBELN"
			,"EKKO"."BUKRS"
			,"EKKO"."LIFNR"
			,"EKPO"."EBELP"
			,"EKPO"."TXZ01"
		FROM "EKKO"
		INNER JOIN "EKPO"
			ON "EKKO"."MANDT" = "EKPO"."MANDT" AND "EKKO"."EBELN" = "EKPO"."EBELN"
		) AS T13
		ON T1."CLIENT" = T13."MANDT" AND T1."PURCHASINGDOC" = T13."EBELN" AND T1."PURCHASINGDOCITEM" = T13."EBELP"
	LEFT JOIN "PA0001" T14
		ON T1."CLIENT" = T14."MANDT" AND T1."PERSONNELNUMBER" = T14."PERNR" AND TO_NVARCHAR(CURRENT_DATE, 'YYYYMMDD') BETWEEN T14."BEGDA"
				AND T14."ENDDA"
	LEFT JOIN "MAKT" T15
		ON T1."CLIENT" = T15."MANDT" AND T1."MATERIALNUMBER" = T15."MATNR" AND T15."SPRAS" = 'E'
	LEFT JOIN "DD07T" AS T16
		ON T1."OFFSETACCTTYPE" = T16."DOMVALUE_L" AND T16."DOMNAME" = 'KOART' AND T16."DDLANGUAGE" = 'E' AND T16."AS4LOCAL" = 'A'
	LEFT JOIN "T001W" T17
		ON T1."CLIENT" = T17."MANDT" AND T1."PLANT" = T17."WERKS"
	INNER JOIN "T004T" T18
		ON T4."MANDT" = T18."MANDT" AND T4."KTOPL" = T18."KTOPL" AND T18."SPRAS" = 'E'
	INNER JOIN "T001" T19
		ON T1."CLIENT" = T19."MANDT" AND T1."COMPANYCODE" = T19."BUKRS"
	INNER JOIN "TGSBT" T20
		ON T1."CLIENT" = T20."MANDT" AND T1."BUSINESSAREA" = T20."GSBER" AND T20."SPRAS" = 'E'
	LEFT JOIN "LFA1" T21
		ON T13."MANDT" = T21."MANDT" AND T13."LIFNR" = T21."LIFNR"
	)
SELECT *
FROM FINAL_DATA;

 	 

END /********* End Procedure Script ************/

 

The key was to sort the records  by  "OBJECTNUMBER" ,"FISCALYEAR" ,"PERIOD" ,"DATETIMECREATED" ,"DOCITEMNUMBER" and assign a row number to each record to get the order I needed.

 

	,SORTED_DATA
AS (
	SELECT *
		,ROW_NUMBER() OVER (
			PARTITION BY "OBJECTNUMBER" ORDER BY "FISCALYEAR"
				,"PERIOD"
				,"DATECREATED_S"
				,"TIMECREATED_S"
				,"DOCITEMNUMBER"
			) AS "ROWNUMBER"
	FROM BASE_DATA
	ORDER BY "OBJECTNUMBER"
		,"FISCALYEAR"
		,"PERIOD"
		,"DATETIMECREATED"
		,"DOCITEMNUMBER"
	)

 

The next step was to get the next settlement document immediately following.  This is where the Row Number comes in.

 

	,MATCHED_DATA
AS (
	SELECT T1.*
		,COALESCE((
				SELECT FIRST_VALUE("REFDOCUMENTNO" ORDER BY "ROWNUMBER")
				FROM SORTED_DATA AS T2
				WHERE T2."OBJECTNUMBER" = T1."OBJECTNUMBER" AND T2."DEBITCREDIT" = 'A' AND T2."ROWNUMBER" > T1."ROWNUMBER" AND T2."COSTELEMENT" = T1."COSTELEMENT" AND T2."REVERSED" = '' AND T2."REVERSALDOC" = '' AND T1."DEBITCREDIT" <> 'A'
				), '') AS "SETTLEMENTDOCUMENT"
        ,COALESCE((
				SELECT FIRST_VALUE("POSTINGDATE_S" ORDER BY "ROWNUMBER")
				FROM SORTED_DATA AS T2
				WHERE T2."OBJECTNUMBER" = T1."OBJECTNUMBER" AND T2."DEBITCREDIT" = 'A' AND T2."ROWNUMBER" > T1."ROWNUMBER" AND T2."COSTELEMENT" = T1."COSTELEMENT" AND T2."REVERSED" = '' AND T2."REVERSALDOC" = '' AND T1."DEBITCREDIT" <> 'A'
				), '') AS "SETTLEMENTDATE_S"				
        ,COALESCE((
				SELECT FIRST_VALUE("DOCUMENTNUMBER" ORDER BY "ROWNUMBER")
				FROM SORTED_DATA AS T2
				WHERE T2."OBJECTNUMBER" = T1."OBJECTNUMBER" AND T2."DEBITCREDIT" = 'A' AND T2."ROWNUMBER" > T1."ROWNUMBER" AND T2."COSTELEMENT" = T1."COSTELEMENT" AND T2."REVERSED" = '' AND T2."REVERSALDOC" = '' AND T1."DEBITCREDIT" <> 'A'
				), '') AS "PRDOCUMENTNUMBER"				
	FROM SORTED_DATA T1
	ORDER BY T1."OBJECTNUMBER"
		,T1."ROWNUMBER"
	)

 

Now you may need to add addition filter criteria because we have only one Controlling Area, etc.
To adjust the totals to meet the distribution rules just join the results to COBRB and apply the appropriate logic.  ie. percentage if percentage then do it to three decimals because SAP has some strange logic for that which I can't figure out.  Anyone know the logic please let me know.

Filter out Debit/Credit = 'A' to remove settlement from the result.

Looking for feedback as well.

entry.title: Re: Production process
entry.content:
Hello @AngelT 

Yes, run Rework Processing, Stock-Manufactured Material (BJN). That‚Äôs the correct Best Practice script for reworking finished stock already in inventory.

Conversion order is NOT a Rework order. In SAP, conversion usually means converting a planned order to a production order standard MRP step, not a rework scenario. There isn‚Äôt a Best Practice script called ‚ÄúConversion order.‚Äù If you meant rework, use BJN (for stock) or BJQ for rework of work-in-process.

BJN/BJQ scope items listed in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition manufacturing scope overview.

Convert Planned Orders app what conversion means. SAP Fiori Apps Library

If your case involves reworking goods that have already been Goods Received (GR‚Äôd) into stock, please contact BJN. If reworking occurs within an open order before the Goods Receipt (GR), use BJQ.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Automate PFCG process
entry.content:
I suspect you are trying to avoid this class somehow because you are not able to create an object using `CREATE OBJECT` or `NEW` as this class has a "private constructor" (create private as part of the class declaration)

That means that only the class itself can create objects of its type. That is the well-known Factory class pattern.

In this case the method which allows you get a new instance of this class is `RETRIEVE_FOR_UPDATE`.

Basically call this method beforehand and grab the `ER_ROLE` parameter inside a reference. Then you use this reference to call `MENU_ADD_TRANSACTION`

entry.title: Re: RRB Billing by Activity Type (Consultant Roles) and Q...
entry.content:
When configuring RRB the primary action is to set up the Dynamic Item Processor (DIP), this is the billing engine that is used for quoting and invoicing.

Refer to SAP Note- 301117 - "Enhanced documentation for dynamic item processor (DIP)" which is extremely helpful.

The summarized quote and invoice is all determined by how you set up the DIP.  The summarization you require is standard RRB.

You are correct, during normal invoicing the Sales Order Line Item is a "dummy" line that just contains the DIP Profile.  For Quote creation the DIP is specified on the PS project.

Through the DIP you can set up the creation of a Sales Quotation from the planned quantities and values on the PS Project. 

For either quoting or invoicing the Output Form is determined via standard SD configuration and master data.

entry.title: Re: How to integrate SAP GRDC with Datasphere for public...
entry.content:
Hello Ahmed,

Good questions. These fields in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition vary depending on whether the communication system is for inbound S/4 receiving calls or outbound S/4 initiating calls to another system.

Host field (Communication System):

  • Enter the URL of the target system (excluding /sap/...).
    • When making an outbound call to SAP BTP or another external system, use the service endpoint URL given by that system.
    • For inbound calls, such as when another system accesses S/4, it‚Äôs best to leave it blank since the S/4HANA Cloud host is automatically determined.

Outbound User:

  • This is the technical user that S/4 will use when making outbound calls.
  • If you have created a Communication User (using Maintain Communication Users) with a password or certificate, enter that user ID here.
  • Assign the inbound caller to the user specified in the Communication Arrangement.

Path field (Communication Arrangement ‚Üí Outbound Services):

  • By default, leave it as /.
  • Only modify this if the external system specifies a particular relative path after the host, such as /api/v1/data.
  • In most standard scenarios, such as SAP-delivered communication cases, / is correct, and the system automatically adds the proper service path.

Briefly

  • Host = endpoint base URL of the external system (if outbound).
  • Outbound User = your technical communication user created in S/4.
  • Path = normally just ‚Äú/‚Äù unless the documentation of the external API says otherwise.

Check below references

SAP Help -How to Create Communication Systems

SAP Help-Communication Arrangements

Let me know if you need any support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: SAP Enable Now - Document template generated output
entry.content:
Hi Melissa,

It is likely that one of three issues is causing your problem:

1. You have applied manual formatting to the text that is not appearing correctly when generated as documentation.  If you have applied manual formatting to text in Enable Now, even if you have also applied a text style, the manual formatting is carried over into the documentation.  To remove the manual formatting, open the text in Producer that is not generating correct, select the text and click the following button


2. You have applied the incorrect text style to the text that is not formatted correctly.  So, open the text in Producer and apply the correct text style to the text

3. When you define a set of Documentation Settings - Resources > Documentation Settings - in Producer, you specify the Text Styles object that is to apply to the documentation when it is generated.  Information like font size is defined in that Text Styles object.  After generating the documentation, click on the text that is not formatted the way that you would like and check the text style that has been applied to the text.  Then check the Text Styles object in Producer - Resources > Adaptable Resources > ... - to determine the formatting that should be applied to the text. 

It may be necessary to duplicate the existing Text Styles object in Resources > Adaptable Resources to create a new object and then apply different styling to the text styles in that object.  You can then apply the new Text Styles object to the Documentation Settings object to ensure that the text is generated with the correct text styles.

Regards
Shane

entry.title: Re: Automatic Purchase Requisition to Purchase order- W/O...
entry.content:
Hello @SB1184 

Great follow-up questions!

Info Record vs. Service Condition Record

    • The Service Info Record in S/4HANA Cloud primarily establishes the link between vendor and service category/material group. The mandatory price field in the Info Record is merely a reference value, not used for detailed pricing
    • The Service Condition Record is where you store the pricing logic, whether it's per service, material group, or text item. This is what the system references during purchase order and service entry sheet processing.

An Info Record serves as a link or reference, while a Condition Record reflects the actual pricing.

Automatic Source Determination in PR

In the Public Cloud, you cannot maintain a manual Source List. Instead, the source of supply is determined automatically from:

      • Contract/Outline Agreement (if one exists for that material/service group & vendor), or
      • Service Info Record (vendor assignment), or
      • Approved Supplier Lists (if enabled).

If none is found, the PR stays without a source, and you assign it manually.

Reference: SAP Learning- Service Purchasing in S/4HANA Cloud

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How can I customize repetitive translations for book...
entry.content:
Hi,

There is no way to modify the way that Translation Hub translates Enable Now content on the Enable Now side.  If this is possible, and I'm not sure that it is, the change would need to be made on the Translation Hub side.  The issue with this is that you are unlikely to be using your own Translation Hub licenses when translating content using Enable Now.  Therefore, even if it were possible to modify Translation Hub to change the way that it translates individual words, when the request is sent by Enable Now to Translation Hub, it would not know that it was to use your customizations.  If it is possible to customize the way that Translation Hub translates individual words, it would be necessary to use your Translation Hub license details.  To specify your license details in Enable Now, open Administration > Server Settings in Manager, and enter your license details in the Features > Machine Translation section of settings.

Regards
Shane

entry.title: Adding a Parent Attachment to all (or some) records that were posted in an Infile
entry.content:
One of the APM Enhancement Requests that came to SAP through the Influence Portal was to have the ability to associate 1 or more attachments for a Manual Adjustment Infile and have those attachments directly linked to the Manual Adjustment (AdjustmentHis) records in APM.

In Release 2405, an enhancement was delivered to accomplish this task in APM.  Follow along as I will walk through the steps to configure this using Batch Entity Updates in APM.

APM uses a feature called Entity Attachments that allows files to be attached to different entities.

There are a couple of mechanisms that control the ability of a User to attach files to an entity.

  •  Security Group:  Within the Security Group for a User, you can enable Entity Attachments for every form for which that user has access (see below).

Figure 1: Global Form Feature: Entity Attachments

  •  Additionally, the User can be assigned access (or restricted) under the specific form's security config. Make sure the user's security group has access to Entity Attachments.

Figure 2:  Form Specific Entity Attachments Security

 

  • Entity Configuration: For some entities, the Entity Attachment configuration is controlled by the Entity Configuration. If you confirmed the Security Group Settings and the Entity Attachment section is not visible on the screen, you will need to create an Entity Configuration for the entity. In this instance, we will need to create an Entity Configuration for InFile. We will be attaching a file to the Manual Adjustment Infile to be pushed to each of the records in the Manual Adjustment File.

Figure 3: Entity Configuration: Enabling Entity Attachments for Infile

 

Creating a Batch Entity Update (BEU) and QBQuery

Once Entity Attachments have been enabled,  you will need to create a BEU ( and a QBQuery ) to take the attachment that is tied to the Manual Adjustment and attach it to the newly created AdjustmentHis records in APM. The BEU needs to run after the AdjustmentHis records have been posted. In this example, we will choose the Process Event After Post Task.

A QBQuery will need to be created that links all of the entities and creates new Entity Attachments for the new AdjustmentHis records.

Figure 4:  Entity Relationship Diagram

Create a QBQuery with a query context of BEU as shown below.

Figure 5: QBQuery Configuration

The QBQuery SQL should tie all of entities together and reference the InFileNo token so that the only records that get reviewed are in the currently posting InFile.

Figure 6: QBQuery

Creating the Batch Entity Update

Navigate to Batch Entity Update Search and Select +.

Fill in the required information:

  • BatchEntityUpdateID
  • QbQueryID (created in the step above)
  • Target EntName (EntityAtt)
  • ProcessEvent (After Post)
  •  Sequence (This sequence number should take into account any other BEUs that may be configured to run in the same task.)
  • UpdateType (Insert. New records are being created in this process)
  • Starting Period: Enter the current period. If a future period is entered, this BEU will not get executed until the entered period is the current period in the system.
  • Payout Type: Enter the Payout Type that the Manual Adjustments will be posted under.

Manage the Mappings

Map the fields from the QBQuery to the associated fields in Entity Attachment. For EntityName, enter "ADJUSTMENTHIS" (Case Sensitive).  Additionally, enter a HardCoded value for UserName for auditing purposes.  The selected UserName should make this BEU easily identifiable as the source of these records.

Figure 7: BEU Mappings

Save and activate the BEU.

 

Importing the Manual Adjustment File and Attaching the File to the InFile

Navigate to the Integration Portal and import the Manual Adjustment file per normal process.

Once the file is imported, scroll to the bottom of the page to the Files section and select + to create a new Entity Attachment tied to the InFile. 

Browse to the location of the File and select Upload. 

NOTE: Some files with advanced features may be blocked from being loaded into APM as a security measure. Excel files with macros and PDFs with autofill are examples of files that may be blocked from being uploaded in APM.

Once the attachments have been uploaded, select Post. Once the post is complete, check the Manual Adjustments tab for the Producer or Vendor to view the attachments.

Figure 8: Newly Created Entity Attachment

 

APM's Entity Attachment functionality is a powerful tool to help maintain financial documents for compliance and reporting purposes.  Feel free to drop a comment or question on this blog. We would love to hear from you!

Please Follow additional APM resources at:

APM WorkZone Site (Requires invitation) 

For Invitation Please email phillip.butts@sap.com or dean.patterson@sap.com 

APM Blogs  

APM Help Docs

entry.title: Re: Personalized Recommendations in SAP SuccessFactors Opportunity Marketplace: Logic and Data Sourc
entry.content:
Hi Rinky,

great content as always.

I often have customers ask "what's the data that drives these recommendations?". 

I can see that you have listed  those details in the Data Sources and  "Recommendation Logic" sections  - and it seems is it fair to say that to really take advantage of these recommendation engines, a customer needs to have implemented TIH/Growth Portfolio. But do they need to have a reasonable library of skills and competencies? Is there a threshold at which better recommendations start to occur? Does having a library with 20 core business competencies work? I would imagine that more --> better results, but are there any indications as to where a business needs to set its sights to start getting "smart" recommendations? How many attributes need to be flagged as "critical" etc. 

As you know, many customer take their first steps into TIH and populating a library of skills in a step by step manner, populating core competencies for perhaps a subset of their population first, then building on that. At what point does it make sense for these customers to start trialing the recommendations? Where's the threshold to having "enough" data points? Or is it different perhaps per customer, and doing trials with some engaged staff, to judge system readiness who won't post disparagingly  that the system just recommended to them a "Rescue from Heights" course for their deskbound office job.

I would assume also that the models behind the recommendations are being adjusted by SAP on a reasonably regular basis to improve thing - so is it perhaps worth trialing after each release if previously the recommendations were not good enough to justify their use?

Thanks for the content!

Chris

entry.title: Fiori Element ListReport initialLoad cannot be Disabled if liveMode is true
entry.content:
Hi,

I'm trying to use the following setting so that I don't get an initial error on the UI, but it's not working.
I would like to get some help with this.
Fiori Elements, I tried with the most recent UI5 versions 1.138.0 and 1.139.0.

There is a mandatory filter field, and I would like the filter to work in live mode, but without initial load.
The expected behavior would be that filtering takes place after every filter setting without pressing the Go button (liveMode true), but there should be no initial filtering when the page loads (intialLoad Disabled), thus avoiding any error messages.

          "name": "sap.fe.templates.ListReport",
          "options": {
            "settings": {
              "initialLoad": "Disabled",
              "liveMode": true,

When I apply this setting in the manifest, the UI always loads with an initial error.

I would like to avoid this initial error.

I have created a GitHub repository with the example here.

Regards,
Peter

entry.title: Systems deletion from SAP Market Place
entry.content:
Hi team,

 

We recently migrated to AWS Cloud, at the time of migration we changed the entire systems hostnames from GLT* to GT5*.

 

We deleted the GLT* systems from the SAP market place, SLD and respective LMDB config. But still we found some of the systems and application servers are showing in the current systems configuration in SAP.

 

Can you please check and help us to remove those systems permanently from the SAP.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Systems deletion from SAP Market Place
entry.content:
Hi *,

 

You want to delete all old systems GLT* from SAP Solution Manager, right?

If yes, Could you please delete/decommission them according to the standard process as described in the KBA 1952567.

1952567 - How to remove no longer relevant managed systems from Solution Manager

----

For example:

  • If Managed System Configuration is already performed, ...,  as of 7.1 SP11 or 7.2 version, there is a new guided procedure for the decommissioning of systems. Please access the Help Portal and perform the steps as mentioned in the operation guide.
    -->SOLMAN_SETUP -> Managed System Configuration -> select a technical system -> Advanced Operations -> Decommissioning

----

 

Best regards,

Leo

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: I am not able to Login in My IAS
entry.content:
To address your concern, only Super Administrators have the ability to add new IAS administrators in SAP. You can contact one of the Super Administrators listed in Users & Contacts - SAP for Me to request access. 

Alternatively, if you need to become a Super Administrator for your company, you can request one of the existing Super Administrators to grant the necessary authorization to your S-user ID as outlined in KBA 2596214 - How to maintain Super, Cloud, and User Administrator S-user IDs listed in My Important Contacts - SAP for Me. 

  • To add a Super Administrator, an existing Super Administrator must provide all authorizations to another S-user ID. Tip: Follow KBA 1614304 to copy or clone their own authorizations.

Hope the above information is helpful to you. 

If you have any questions or need further assistance, please feel free to contact us. 

Best regards,
Judy 
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: [SAP BTP Onboarding Series] Joule ‚Äì Getting Started with Joule and SAP SuccessFactors
entry.content: Hi @nageshcaparthy  In your section 5.2.2 you correctly point out "that accessing SAP SuccessFactors APIs using Basic Authentication has been deprecated. You can create certificate-based destinations". However no such option is available. The SAP Help also says this but does not mention what or how this is to be done. Can you provide the details on how this can be achieved as it is not a straight forward thing to do - it likely involves first having to in SAP BTP creating a Destination Certificate for this purpose - exporting the X.509 certificate part and then Registering that in SuccessFactors as new OAuth Client Application.  But in the SAP BTP destination creation for LPS_SFSF_dt the option for Client Certificate Authentication or perhaps OAuth with X.509 Client Certificates is not presented as an authentication option

entry.title: Inquiry about API equivalent for "Post Goods Issue"
entry.content:

entry.title: Re: Inquiry about API equivalent for "Post Goods Issue"
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

Currently SAP Business ByDesign has no standard web service to perform Post Goods Issue against delivery proposal. You can try to create warehouse request for the delivery proposal, and then use standard web service ManageSiteLogisticsTaskIn to confirm following warehouse task.

Henry

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Whether to consider the FRUN SPS upgrade?
entry.content:
Dear Customer, 

It's suggested to have a look at the latest FRUN EWA report chapter "Age of Support Packages", in case the support package older than 24 months, an SPS upgrade is suggested.

SAP delivers security corrections via support packages. For critical issues, security notes are also provided to ensure that these issues can also be closed between support package upgrades. Security notes with priority "very high" or "high" are provided for support packages of the last 24 months. For older support packages, individual security notes may no longer be available. An update to sufficiently current support package levels is therefore essential for the security of the system. Therefore, the section appears in the EWA report.

Please see what's new in the SAP Focused Run new release from link https://help.sap.com/whats-new/7c55af78977145179a4940077447473d. The latest FRUN is 5.1, please also see SAP Note 0003603061 - SAP Focused Run 5.0 Feature Package 01 - Update Preparation and Postprocessing Documentation.

Best regards,
Vera Jiang

entry.title: Generate Direct Link doesn't send users to correct SSO page
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We are new to SuccessFactors Learning. Our biggest bugbear at the moment is with the Generate Direct Link function to direct people to courses/items/classes. When we create a link and provide it to users - if they've logged into SuccessFactors within the last 30 minutes, the link works and sends the learner to the correct course/item/class. If they haven't logged into SF recently, one of the following options happens: 

  • the user is directed to our sign-on page, they are able to access the LMS, they are directed to the course once they've logged in - this option is VERY RARE. 
  • the user is directed to an SAP login page, they are asked for a username and password - their username and password doesn't work. 
  • the user is directed to an SAP login page, they are asked for a username but NOT password - it doesn't work

This is not ideal, obviously, and is the major complaint we are receiving from users and admins, we also have a large number of external users who had previously been directed to training very easily. 

We have done a lot of testing to try and make the links work (ie, send people to the correct login page) We have tried adding &loginMethod=SSO to the end of the link after it is created, and adding &nocache=#### (where #### is a random number). neither of these have worked. 

Is there a way to guarantee that, should someone click a link generated in SF Learning and NOT be logged in previously, they are directed to the sign-in page that works? 

Please let me know what further information I can provide. 

Thank you.

entry.title: How the capacity planning works in warehouse management (public cloud)?
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Could you please explain how capacity planning functions in warehouse management within SAP Public Cloud?

The client‚Äôs requirement involves handling two types of storage bins:

  • Storage bin with a capacity of 1.0 TO

  • Storage bin with a capacity of 1.5 TO

There is a material called SS wire roll, which is procured from different suppliers and varies in weight. Using batch-specific units of measure during synchronous goods receipt, the process is as follows:

  • Material with a weight less than or equal to 1.0 TO should be placed in a 1.0 TO bin.

  • Material with a weight greater than 1.0 TO but less than or equal to 1.5 TO should be stored in a 1.5 TO bin

Additionally, if all 1.0 TO bins are full, materials weighing less than or equal to 1.0 TO may need to be placed in a 1.5 TO bin, with up to 4 quantities per bin depending on their size.

 

How the process can be mapped in sap public cloud warehouse management? please advise me on priority.

entry.title: Re: Goods Receipt in Advance Production Integration in SA...
entry.content:
In an SAP S/4HANA Embedded EWM setup, production integration relies on Expected Goods Receipt (EGR) and inbound deliveries generated internally within EWM. Unlike decentralized systems, inbound deliveries are not pushed from ERP ‚Äî they are triggered by confirming the manufacturing order and processed entirely within EWM.

So when using RFUI or /SCWM/GRPI, the system expects either:

  • an EGR document linked to the manufacturing order, or
  • a manually selected inbound delivery created from that EGR.

If neither exists or is selected, errors like ‚ÄúNo expected goods receipt found for m‚Äù or ‚ÄúIndicators for selecting inbound deliveries and EGR are initial‚Äù will occur.

So the solution is

  • ensure EGR generation is active via BC Set /SCWM/DLV_INBOUND_PROD.
  • Confirm your production storage location is EWM-managed.
  • Use /SCWM/GRPI with ‚ÄúExpected Goods Receipt‚Äù checkbox selected.
  • Validate that document types INBM and item types IDPD are configured.
  • Assign a work center to a bin for RFUI to function properly.

entry.title: Re: How to add the Freight Charges during GRN ?
entry.content:
Some recommended approaches are

Use Unplanned Delivery Costs During Invoice Posting. With this approach, after GR, when the freight amount is known, post the invoice using Manage Supplier Invoices app. In the invoice, enter the freight amount in the ‚ÄúUnplanned Delivery Costs‚Äù field. SAP will allocate the cost to the material if valuation is allowed, Or post it to a price difference account. This method is clean, auditable, and works well for freight paid directly to the transporter.

The other option is to use a Separate Freight PO (Optional). If freight is frequent and managed by a logistics provider, create a Freight Framework PO. Post freight invoices separately using service PO or subsequent debit. This keeps freight accounting separate from material valuation and allows better tracking.

SAP standard behavior is partial GR handling, to proportionally allocate freight based on received quantity. If you want fixed freight per GR, configure the freight condition type with:

  • Calculation Type = B (Fixed Amount)
  • Scale Basis = B (Quantity)
  • Disable Quantity Conversion

This ensures freight is posted per GR event, not proportionally

In short, the summary is

entry.content:
